1 bag (220 g) Tostitos® Restaurant Style Tortilla Chips
2 cups (500 mL) prepared pulled pork
1/2 jar (394 mL jar) Tostitos® Salsa Con Queso
2 cups (500 mL) blended coleslaw mix
1/3 cup (75 mL) coleslaw dressing
Directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Spread tortilla chips in single layer on large baking sheet. Top with pulled pork and Salsa Con Queso. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until warmed through. 
Meanwhile, in small bowl, toss coleslaw mix with dressing. Top nachos with coleslaw; serve immediately

Title: Pulled Short Rib Tacos
Description: These tacos are perfect for using up left over cooked beef. Restaurant quality meals are a breeze to put together at home and super impressive when hosting taco night.
Ingredients:
1 jar (418 mL) Tostitos® Salsa
3 cups (750 mL) leftover cooked beef, such as short ribs, pot roast or brisket
12 corn tortillas (7-inch)
1 cup (250 mL) Tostitos® Salsa Con Queso
1/3 cup (75 mL) thinly sliced radish
1/4 cup (60 mL) fresh cilantro leaves
Directions:
In saucepan, heat salsa and beef over medium heat. Wrap tortillas in foil and warm in 325°F (160°C) oven for about 10 minutes or until heated through.
Top tortillas with beef mixture, Salsa Con Queso, radish and cilantro leaves.

Title: Buffalo Chicken Dip
Description: This dip couldn’t be easier to put together. With short preparation time you’ll be able to get more game time and less kitchen time.
Ingredients:
1 bag (220 g) Tostitos® Scoops! Tortilla Chips
1 jar (394 mL) Tostitos® Salsa Con Queso
2 cups (500 mL) shredded cooked chicken
2 tbsp (60 mL) Buffalo wing style hot sauce (such as Frank’s RedHot® Buffalo Wings sauce)
1/4 cup (60 mL) sliced green onion
Directions:
In saucepan, combine Salsa Con Queso, cooked chicken and hot sauce over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for about 10 minutes or until heated through.
Transfer to serving dish; sprinkle with green onion and serve with Scoops!

Title: Jalapeño Popper Dip
Description: Jalapeños, bacon and cheese? Oh my! You can never go wrong with these palate-pleasing ingredients.
Ingredients:
1 bag (220 g) Tostitos® Cantina Extra Thick Tortilla Chips
1 jar (394 mL) Tostitos® Salsa Con Queso
1/2 cup (125 mL) pickled jalapeño peppers, drained, chopped and divided
1/3 cup (75 mL) cooked bacon, crumbled
1/3 cup (75 mL) panko bread crumbs
Cooking spray
1 green onion, sliced
Directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Pour Salsa Con Queso into 2‑cup (500 mL) ovenproof baking dish; stir in 1/3 cup (75 mL) jalapeño peppers. In separate bowl, toss together remaining jalapeños, bacon and panko; sprinkle over dip. Spray with cooking spray.
Bake for 20 minutes. Change oven setting to broil; cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until crumb mixture is golden brown. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve with tortilla chips.

Title: Mexican Poutine
Description: This Mexican-Canadian mash up is perfect for snacking, entertaining or enjoying after a night out.
Ingredients:
1 cup (250 mL) Tostitos® Salsa
1 bag (650 g) frozen French fries
1 tsp (5 mL) Tex-Mex seasoning
1 cup (250 mL) shredded marble cheese
1/2 cup (125 mL) prepared guacamole
1/4 cup (60 mL) sour cream
Directions:
Toss fries with Tex‑Mex seasoning; bake according to package directions on foil‑lined baking sheet. 
Sprinkle with cheese and continue baking for 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with salsa, guacamole and sour cream.

Title: Tuna Poke with Tortillas
Description: Poke is a trendy Hawaiian salad that consists of high quality raw fish and flavourful seasonings. Try this version at your next party or get together.
Ingredients:
1 bag (220 g) Tostitos® Multigrain Tortilla Chips
12 oz (340 g) sushi-grade tuna
1 clove garlic, minced
2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
2 tbsp (30 mL) rice wine vinegar
2 tsp (10 mL) sesame oil
2 green onions, finely sliced
1 red chili pepper, seeded and minced
Directions:
Cut tuna into 1/4‑inch (5 mm) cubes. In bowl, whisk together garlic, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, green onions and chili pepper. Add tuna; toss well. 
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 1 day. Serve with tortilla chips.

Title: Mango Avocado Tuna Poke
Description: Bursting with juicy mango and creamy avocado, this Hawaiian inspired salad is an easy and delicious way to add new and exciting flavours to your party spread.
Ingredients:
1 bag (220 g) Tostitos ® Multigrain Tortilla Chips
12 oz (340 g) sushi-grade tuna
1/2 cup (125 mL) chopped mango
2 tbsp (30 mL) soy sauce
2 tbsp (30 mL) lime juice
1 tbsp (15 mL) minced fresh ginger
2 tsp (10 mL) sesame oil
1 1/2 tsp (7 mL) Asian red chili-garlic paste, such as sambal oelek
1 ripe avocado, diced
Directions:
Cut tuna into 1/4‑inch (5 mm) cubes; toss with mango. 
Whisk together soy sauce, lime juice, ginger, sesame oil and chili‑garlic paste; drizzle over tuna and mango. Add avocado and toss to coat well. Serve with tortilla chips.

Title: Tortilla-Crusted Ravioli
Description: A unique twist on pasta- these crunchy, crusted ravioli are perfect for snack time or dinner time!
Ingredients:
1/2 bag (220 g bag) Tostitos® Cantina Extra Thick Tortilla Chips
1/2 cup (125 mL) finely grated Parmesan cheese
2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
1/2 tsp (2 mL) paprika
Pinch cayenne pepper
8 oz (250 g) frozen cheese ravioli
1 egg white
1/2 jar (418 mL jar) Tostitos® Medium Salsa
Directions:
Preheat oven to 400ºF (200ºC). Pulse tortilla chips in food processor until bread crumb consistency. In shallow dish, combine tortilla chips, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, paprika and cayenne.
Cook ravioli for half of the time recommended on package directions. Drain and spread on baking sheet allowing space in between; let cool slightly.
Whisk egg white with 1 tbsp (15 mL) water lightly until foamy. Dip ravioli in egg white mixture, then in tortilla mixture. Place on parchment paper–lined baking sheet. Bake, turning once, for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden and crisp. Serve warm with salsa.

Title: Chile Con Carne Tacos
Description: Chile and tacos come together for this fun and easy dinner time meal. Sure to please kids and adults alike!
Ingredients:
1 jar (418 mL) Tostitos ® Chunky Salsa
1 tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
1 onion, chopped
1 lb (500 g) ground beef
1 tbsp (15 mL) chili powder
1 can (19 oz/540 mL) red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
12 corn tortillas (7-inch)
1 cup (250 mL) shredded Cheddar cheese
1/2 cup (125 mL) diced red pepper
2 green onions, sliced
Directions:
Heat vegetable oil in large saucepan set over medium‑high heat; add onion, ground beef and chili powder. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned. Add salsa, kidney beans and 1 cup (250 mL) water; bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. 
Divide chili mixture evenly among warmed tortillas. Top with cheese, red pepper and green onions.

Title: Chipotle Guacamole Recipe
Description: Add a little heat to your guacamole with spicy, smoky chipotles.
Ingredients:
1 bag (220 g) Tostitos Cantina® Extra Thick Tortilla Chips
2 ripe avocados, pitted and peeled
1 canned chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, chopped
1/4 cup (60 mL) finely diced onion
1 clove garlic, minced
2 tbsp (30 mL) lime juice
2 tbsp (30 mL) sour cream
1/4 tsp (1 mL) salt
Directions:
Mash avocado with chipotle chile until smooth. Stir in onion, garlic, lime juice, sour cream and salt.
Serve with tortilla chips.

Title: Pepperoni Pizza Nachos
Description: Perfect for serving a crowd, these easy pizza-style nachos are irresistibly delicious!
Ingredients:
1 bag (230 g) Tostitos® Hint of Jalapeño Flavoured Tortilla Chips
1 1/4 cups (300 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
1 cup (250 mL) halved cherry tomatoes
1/2 cup (125 mL) pizza sauce
1 cup (250 mL) pepperoni slices
Directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). 
Arrange tortilla chips in pizza pan. Layer cheese and cherry tomatoes over top; drizzle with pizza sauce. Scatter pepperoni slices over top.
Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese starts to melt.

Title: Crunchy Tortilla-Crusted Chicken Wings
Description: Serve these oven-baked crispy wings for dinner, game night or as a party appetizer.
Ingredients:
2 cups (500 mL) Tostitos® Hint of Jalapeño Flavoured Tortilla Chips, crushed
2 lb (500 g) split chicken wings
1/4 tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper
1/4 cup (60 mL) all-purpose flour
2 eggs, beaten
1 tbsp (15 mL) canola oil
Sour cream, for serving
Salsa, for serving
Directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). 
Season wings with salt and pepper. 
Toss wings in flour, shaking off excess; dip into eggs, then coat with crushed tortilla chips. 
Arrange wings on lightly greased foil‑lined baking sheet; drizzle with oil. 
Bake, turning once, for about 50 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. 
Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Title: Hint of Jalapeño Caprese Crostini
Description: Sautéing mini tomatoes until their skins start to blister concentrates the flavour, making them the perfect topping for warm crostini.
Ingredients:
24 Tostitos® Hint of Jalapeño Flavoured Tortilla Chips
2 tbsp (30 mL) olive oil
2 cups (500 mL) grape tomatoes
1/4 tsp (1 mL) each salt and pepper
2 tbsp (30 mL) prepared balsamic glaze
1 cup (250 mL) pearl bocconcini
1/4 cup (60 mL) finely sliced fresh basil
Directions:
Heat oil in large heavy‑bottom skillet set over medium‑high heat.
Sauté tomatoes, salt and pepper for about 8 minutes or until skins start to blister. Drizzle with balsamic glaze. 
Cook for about 2 minutes or until tomatoes are well coated and juices thickened.
Arrange tortilla chips on baking sheet. Top with tomatoes and pearl bocconcini.
Broil for 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. 
Garnish with basil; serve immediately.

Title: Charred Avocado and Chicken Nachos
Ingredients:
2 avocados
1 medium red onion
1 tbsp olive oil
Pinch of salt and pepper
1 cup cooked and cubed chicken
2 cups shredded Tex-Mex cheese
1/2 bag Tostitos® Hint of Jalapeño tortilla chips
2 tbsp chopped parsley, for garnish, optional
Directions:
Preheat oven to 375F.
Split avocados in half and remove pit.  Slice red onion into  1/2 inch thick rounds and remove peel, leaving rings intact.
Brush avocado halves and both sides of onion rings lightly with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. Arrange onion rings on pan and cook until slightly softened and lightly charred on one side, about 1‑2 minutes. Flip onions using a spatula or tongs and continue cooking on second side. Add avocado halves to pan and cook until lightly charred and grill marked, 2 minutes. Remove onions and avocado halves to chopping board and allow to cool slightly, 2 minutes.
When cool enough to handle slice onions into bite sized pieces. Remove skin from avocados and roughly chop. 
Place Tostitos® Hint of Jalapeño tortilla chips onto baking sheet in a single layer. Spread chicken, onions and avocado evenly over chips and sprinkle with cheese. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly, 4‑5 minutes.  Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve warm.

Title: Cucumber & Radish Salsa
Ingredients:
1 bag Tostitos Cantina® Extra Thick tortilla chips
1/2 lb (250 g)  radishes, trimmed and finely chopped
1 English cucumber, finely chopped
1/3 cup (75 mL) finely chopped red onion
1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1 small clove garlic, minced
2 tbsp (30 mL) lime juice
1 tsp (5 mL) kosher salt
1/2 tsp (2 mL) ground cumin
1/4 cup (60 mL) chopped cilantro
Directions:
1. In serving bowl, stir together radishes, cucumber, red onion, jalapeño, garlic, lime juice, salt and cumin until well combined. Stir in cilantro. Let stand for 10 minutes. 
2. Serve salsa with Tostitos Cantina® Extra Thick tortilla chips for dipping.

Title: Southwest Nachos
Description: Impress guests with a platter of cheesy nachos loaded with grilled steak, corn, and fresh tomatoes – with a pop of heat from the jalapeño peppers.
Ingredients:
1 bag (275 g) Tostitos® Hint of Roasted Garlic tortilla chips
1/4 cup (60 mL) Tostitos® Roasted Red Pepper salsa
1 flat iron steak (3/4 lb/375 g)
1/2 tsp (2 mL) each salt and pepper
2 cups (500 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
2 cups (500 mL) cooked corn kernels
1/4 cup (60 mL) thinly sliced jalapeño peppers
1 cup (250 mL) quartered grape tomatoes
1/2 cup (125 mL) crumbled feta cheese
Directions:
Preheat grill to medium‑high; grease grates well. Season steak with salt and pepper; grill, turning once, for 8 to 10 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) on instant‑read thermometer. Transfer to plate and tent with foil. Let stand for 10 minutes. 
Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Slice steak against the grain into thin strips. Scatter Tostitos® Hint of Roasted Garlic tortilla chips in even layer on large baking sheet. Top with steak, mozzarella, corn and jalapeño. 
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until mozzarella is melted and lightly browned. Sprinkle tomatoes and feta over top.
Drizzle with Tostitos® Roasted Red Pepper salsa if desired.

Title: Easy Mexican Cheese Bites
Description: Get out of the kitchen and join the party by keeping the snacks simple with these yummy bites that look great – and are soooo quick to make!
Ingredients:
48 Tostitos® Scoops!® tortilla chips
1/2 cup (125 mL) Tostitos® Mild Salsa
1-250 g pkg (8 oz) plain brick-style cream cheese, at room temperature
2 tbsp (30 mL) taco seasoning blend
1/2 cup (125 mL) sour cream
1/2 cup (125 mL) shredded cheddar cheese
1 large ripe avocado, finely chopped
1 large ripe tomato, seeded and diced
1/4 cup (60 mL) thinly sliced green onions or parsley
Directions:
Arrange Tostitos® Scoops!® tortilla chips on serving platter. Beat cream cheese with taco seasoning until softened and well combined; stir in sour cream, shredded cheddar cheese and Tostitos® Mild Salsa. 
Spoon 2 tsp (10 mL) filling into each Tostitos® Scoops!® tortilla chip; top with avocado and tomato. Sprinkle with sliced green onions or parsley. Serve immediately.

Title: Jerk Chicken Nachos
Description: These quick and easy nachos inspired by flavours of the Caribbean make the perfect Super Bowl snack.
Ingredients:
1 cup (250 mL) shredded rotisserie chicken
1/2 cup (125 mL) prepared jerk BBQ sauce, divided
1 bag (275 g) Tostitos® Hint of Roasted Garlic Tortilla Chips
2 cups (500 mL) shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup (125 mL) diced pineapple
1 jalapeño pepper, diced
2 tbsp (30 mL) finely chopped fresh chives
Directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss chicken with 1/4 cup (60 mL) jerk BBQ sauce. Lay half of the tortilla chips on large pizza pan or baking sheet. Scatter half of the cheese, chicken and pineapple over top. Repeat layers.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with jalapeño and chives. Drizzle remaining BBQ sauce over nachos.
